content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 5 in the graph given is: 6->3->5

This path follows the edges (arrows) from the graph, starting from node 6, going to node 3, then to node 5. There are no intermediate nodes or edges not shown in the graph.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 6 in the graph given is: 5->4->6

This path follows the edges (arrows) from the graph, starting from node 5, going to node 4, then to node 6. There are no intermediate nodes or edges not shown in the graph.
